main event: An oval-shaped gray-white object was observed in the night sky near Seneca, Kansas on August 3, 1955.
interesting points: The object changed direction abruptly during the observation.,The object resembled a star or planet initially.,It was seen for about 2 to 3 minutes.,No sound was reported during the sighting.,The sighting occurred on a clear, moonlight night.
witness description: The report does not specify the identity of the witness.
